benchmark_details.name: LFRQA (Long-form RobustQA)
benchmark_details.overview: LFRQA is a new dataset comprising human-written long-form answers that integrate short extractive answers from multiple documents into a single, coherent narrative, covering 26K queries across seven different domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate the evaluation of RAG-QA systems on domain robustness and the quality of answers generated by large language models.

data.source: Human annotations based on multiple source documents.
data.annotation: Long-form answers manually annotated by human experts.

methodology.calculation: Not specified; based on evaluation preferences.
methodology.interpretation: Results are interpreted based on win-rate comparisons between model-generated answers and the ground-truth from LFRQA.
methodology.validation: Evaluations are validated through human preference judgments and automated model comparisons.
